src Package¶

exportClass Module¶

Created on Jan 14, 2014

@author: paepcke

Web service partner to exportClass.html. Uses Tornado to listen to port 8080 under SSL protocol. Accepts requests for exporting the data of one class. Can export just anonymized part of the class info, or more, i.e. data that includes potentially personally identifiable information (PII). If PII is involved, data is encrypted into a .zip file. Either way the data is deposited in /home/dataman/Data/CustomExcerpts/CourseSubdir/<tables>.csv.

class src.exportClass.CourseCSVServer(application, request, testing=False)¶

Bases: src.tornado.websocket.WebSocketHandler

addClientInstructions(inclPII)¶

Send the draft of an email message for the client back to the browsser. The message will contain the URL to where the client can pick up the result. If personally identifiable information was requested, the draft will include instructions for opening the zip file.

Parameters:inclPII (Boolean) – whether or not PII was requested
allow_draft76()¶

Allow WebSocket connections via the old Draft-76 protocol. It has some security issues, and was replaced. However, Safari (i.e. e.g. iPad) don’t implement the new protocols yet. Overriding this method, and returning True will allow those connections.

cancelTimer()¶
constructDeliveryDir(courseName)¶

Given a course name, construct a directory name where result files for that course will be stored to be visible on the Web. The parent dir is expected in CourseCSVServer.DELIVERY_HOME. The leaf dir is constructed as DELIVERY_HOME/courseName

Parameters:courseName (String) – course name for which results will be deposited in the dir
Returns:Two-tuple: the already existing directory path, and flag PreExisted.EXISTED if the directory already existed. Method does nothing in this case. If the directory did not exist, the constructed directory plus PreExisting.DID_NOT_EXIST are returned. Creation includes all intermediate subdirectories.
Return type:(String, PreExisting)
echoParms()¶
exportClass(detailDict)¶

Export basic info about one class: EventXtract, VideoInteraction, and ActivityGrade. {courseId : <the courseID>, wipeExisting : <true/false wipe existing class tables files>}

Parameters:detailDict ({String : String, String : Boolean}) – Dict with all info necessary to export standard class info.
exportTimeEngagement(detailDict)¶

Export two CSV files: a summary of time effort aggregated over all students, and a per-student-per-week aggregation. detailDict provides any necessary info:

{courseId : <the courseID>, wipeExisting : <true/false wipe existing class tables files>}

Places names of three temp files into instance variables:

  • self.latestResultSummaryFilename = summaryFile
  • self.latestResultDetailFilename = detailFile
  • self.latestResultWeeklyEffortFilename = weeklyEffortFile
Parameters:detailDict ({String : String, String : Boolean}) – Dict with all info necessary to export standard class info.
Returns:tri-tuple of three filenames: the engagement summary .csv file, the engagement detail file .csv file, and the engagement weekly effort filename.
Return type:(String,String,String)
getDeliveryURL(courseId)¶

Given a course ID string, return a URL from which completed course tables can be picked up:

Parameters:courseId (String) – course identifier, e.g.: /networking/EE120/Fall
Returns:URL at which tables computed for a class are visible.
Return type:String
handleCourseNamesReq(requestName, args)¶
logDebug(msg)¶
logErr(msg)¶
logInfo(msg)¶
on_message(message)¶

Connected browser requests action: “<actionType>:<actionArg(s)>, where actionArgs is a single string or an array of items.

Parameters:message (string) – message arriving from the browser
open()¶

Called by WebSocket/tornado when a client connects. Method must be named ‘open’

printClassTableInfo(inclPII)¶

Writes html to browser that shows result table file names and sizes. Also sends a few lines from each table as samples. In case of PII-including reports, only one file exists, and it is zipped and encrypted.

Parameters:inclPII (Boolean) – whether or not the report includes PII
queryCourseNameList(courseID)¶

Given a MySQL regexp courseID string, return a list of matchine course_display_name in the db. If self.mysql is None, indicating that the __init__() method was unable to log into the db, then return None.

Parameters:courseID (String) – Course name regular expression in MySQL syntax.
Returns:An array of matching course_display_name, which may be empty. None if _init__() was unable to log into db.
Return type:{[String] | None}
reportProgress()¶

Writes a dot to remote browser to indicate liveness. Restarts timer for next dot.

setTimer(time=None)¶
writeError(msg)¶

Writes a response to the JS running in the browser that indicates an error. Result action is “error”, and “args” is the error message string:

Parameters:msg (String) – error message to send to browser
writeResult(responseName, args)¶

Write a JSON formatted result back to the browser. Format will be:

{"resp" : "<respName>", "args" : "<jsonizedArgs>"}

That is, the args will be turned into JSON that is the in the response’s “args” value:

Parameters:
  • responseName (String) – name of result that is recognized by the JS in the browser
  • args ({int | String | [String] | ...}) – any Python datastructure that can be turned into JSON
zipFiles(destZipFileName, cryptoPwd, filePathsToZip)¶

Creates an encrypted zip file.

Parameters:
  • destZipFileName (String) – full path of the final zip file
  • cryptoPwd (String) – password to which zip file will be encrypted
  • filePathsToZip ([String]) – array of full file paths to zip
